reviews.review_msg: Josh is a great prof.  He always brought up interesting points and new angles to old topics, in an entertaining manner.  Pretty bright and has a sense of humour.  Take something with him, you won't regret it.
fun, except for tutorials

Professor Ali was amazing. Essays were marked tough but overall fair. He is the best prof ever. Midterm was a little challenging but the Final was a piece of cake. Would take a class with Professor Ali again.

Took geog 102 with him for socials breadth and was very easy.  Two essays, a small presentation and a midterm and final was the class.  Lots of things taught seem intuitive although learn the specific lists he wants you to know and you're golden.  Lectures were dry but weren't the worst.  Seems like a nice enough guy.  TAs for the class were cool.

Professor Ali is very detail-oriented and organized in terms of notes and assignment instructions. He enjoys the material and encourages questions during lectures. The subject is quite dry and requires a lot of memorization. Midterm was challenging compared to the easy final. Participation in tutorial is essential to doing well in the course.
Super boring class!!!

I am taking both GEOG 102 and GEOG 111 with Faran. GEOG 102 (World Problems) is by far the most interesting course I have ever taken, and GEOG 111 is a must for understanding Earth Systems. I am satisfied with both the courses. Very organized, knowledgeable and caring prof, great lecture notes, and very fair tests. I did very well on both midterms.

I am taking both GEOG 102 and GEOG 111 with Faran Ali. GEOG 102 (World Problems) is by far the most interesting course I have ever taken, and GEOG 111 is a must for understanding Earth Systems. I am more than satisfied with both the courses. Very organized, knowledgeable and caring prof, great lecture notes, and very fair tests. Actually, I did ver

Easy Prof.  Long slides, he high lights 23 of the lecture slides . Attendance is not mandatory, he uploads the slides online. Study the slides and you will pass. There is a easy group presentation 10-15 minutes. Although sometimes hard to follow him because he mumbles. Overall easy class with easy prof.

Very clear with what would be on the exams, but the assignments were a little all over the place. He would give very short descriptions and then take off marks for things that were not in the assignment outlines. I would still recommend taking the course with him, just go visit him frequently and know exactly what he wants from you.
So incredibly kind, genuinely cares for students. Exams = more than fair. Just the best professor SFU has ever had.

Trys his best to clarify what's gonna be tested and what's not. Don't need the textbook, as the you'll only be tested based on what's on the lecture slides. Attendance is not required, but does help. Overall it's a good course, fairly easy. Put in some effort and should be an easy A. Highly recommend this prof and this course.
Mid terms are fair. its basically all from the lecture slides. 2 assignments in the course, fairly easy topics! Easy elective

GEOG 102 (World Problems) is is an interesting and eye-opening overview to the world's current environmental problems. Faran is a real nice prof, always friendly and ready to help.  There are just two assignments and the tutorials are fun with useful discussions. Everybody passed the mid-term. I would recommend this course.

extremely hard to understand, the lectures are boring and hard to stay concentrated in. Exams have questions irrelevant to course material and the labs are very hard. would not recommend if you do not have a background in the subject.

This class is definitely interesting to me, but the lectures were useless. He read off of the powerpoints (and that was when you could understand him). Very easy class though, textbook is not needed. Just read his lecture notes and you'll be set.
Yawn!!!! The prof does not show enthusiasm for the material. To top it off, he is not able to explain the materials well. Regret taking this course but it is compulsory for me.

Excellent teacher. Lectures are interesting and hes got lots of enthusiasm for the subjects. While there are a lot of readings for the course they are, for the most part, great selections which give multiple sides of the topics.
Great teacher. Basic first year course but interesting nonetheless.
Fun to listen to, one of the best courses I've taken so far.
Nice guy, but lectures seemed a bit unorganized (topics would often spill over to next class). Funny stories make lectures go by a bit faster. Posts slides, which is all you need to study.

One of the best profs I've ever had. Very clear and knowledgeable on the topic. Lectures were always very informative and entertaining. Slides are really good and fit really well with the actual presentation. Very helpful.  Again - fantastic prof.

Awesome prof! Really nice, helpful and happy to answer questions/share info. Would be nice if powerpoint notes went up faster. Assignments were a good length and got me thinking about material. Not too much reading which was great! One of the first uni classes where I feel I've actually learned something useful for the 'real world'.
No Comments
bet prof

Great prof, very passionate about what he does - bit monotone but funny, goes through slides FAST so bring a laptop, however lectures are recorded - but it takes longer to type up notes from recordings so just attend the lectures. Fair marking, fair assignments and encourages discussion - took REM 100 with him as well.
